text: Here's how to add subtitles to a video
using YouTube Studio and Premiere Pro.
Use the clickable sections below

to skip to different
parts of this tutorial.

In YouTube, click on
"Your videos" on the left.
Make sure "Content" is selected

and select the video you
want to add subtitles to
by clicking on the thumbnail.
Select "Subtitles" from the left here.
Set the language of your subtitles.
And click "CONFIRM."

Click "ADD" under subtitles
here to add your subtitles.

Choose "Type manually" to
manually input your subtitles.

Type the subtitle you want
to add in the box here.

Click the blue plus icon
to add more subtitles.
Play the video and pause
wherever you want to add a subtitle.
In the section below the video,
you can drag the new caption or subtitle

to adjust when and for how
long it will appear on screen.

Once you're finished, click
"PUBLISH" or "SAVE DRAFT."

In Premiere Pro, click
the "New item" icon here
and select "Captions."
In the pop-up,

select "Open Captions"
from the drop-down here
and make sure your time and video settings
are matching your video output.
Click "OK."
Drag and drop your captions

onto an empty video
layer above your video.

Extend it so that it covers
the length of the video.

Double-click the layer to
open the captions panel here.

You can undock it and
enlarge it if you wish.
Here you can add your captions.
Click "+" here to add new captions.
Adjust font, size, spacing,
and manually modify other settings
by using the controls here.
Click and drag each black caption
on the layer of the timeline
to move, lengthen, or shorten them.
To export, go to "File,"
"Export,"
and then "Captions."
Make sure your file format is .srt

and check the box to
"Include SRT Styling."
Click "OK."

Choose the name and destination
for your captions file
and click "Save."

In YouTube Studio, select
"Content" from the left here.
Click the thumbnail of the video
you want to add subtitles to.
Go to "Subtitles" on the left.

Click "ADD" under
"Subtitles" on the right.
Choose "Upload file."
Make sure "With timing" is selected
and click "CONTINUE."

Choose your exported captions
file and click "Open."

Your captions will now
be added to your video.
Click "PUBLISH" to complete the process.
